alert.note: Alert for Adair; Dallas; Guthrie; Madison (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 7:07AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MADISON...SOUTHERN GUTHRIE...NORTHEASTERN ADAIR AND SOUTHWESTERN DALLAS COUNTIES THROUGH 745 AM CDT... At 707 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Stuart, or 8 miles southeast of Guthrie Center, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Adel, Guthrie Center, Stuart, Dallas Center, Earlham, Panora, De Soto, Lake Panorama, Redfield, Adair, Dexter, Casey, Diamondhead Lake, Menlo, and Linden. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 81 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
